version.change: Allow na in read.xlsx, getSheetContents, [, etc. to be a vector with more than one value so that we can map values to .
Pass ... arguments to read.xlsx on to getSheetContents. This allows support for, e.g, header.
excelDoc checks the magic number of the file is PK.
excelDoc allows the caller to specify their own template file when creating a new document. Suggested by Marc Kirchner.
cells/getCellNodes now allows getting either all the cells or all the non-empty cells, i.e. that have a v node.
setCellStyle and createStyle allow us to change the appearance of one or more cells in a work sheet.
setColWidth allows one to change the width of one or more columns in a work sheet.
Allow ranges to be specified in the form "B2:D8" in subsetting.
sheet[i, j, asFormula] = "A1 + A2 + sum(B3:B7)" allows insertion of formulas for cells and clears the value and type.
hyperlinks handles links to anchors within the document, including across sheets.
lapply method for Workbook works correctly now.
Support for several more variations/combinations of sheet[i, j] with missing arguments, logical vectors, negative indices, etc.
Fixed handling of columns with cells with no values.
Added conversion of columns to, e.g., dates based on the style/format of the columns.
